CN.content:

2. PEBDTPD

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The HOMO levels of the POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers were -5.23 and -5.37 eV , respectively.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. HOMO (Hydrogen-Oriented Molecular Orbital)
2. POBDTPD (Polymer with Backbone-Directed Triple Bonds)
3. PEBDTPD (Polymer with Backbone-Directed Triple Bonds and Double Bonds)

These entities are mentioned in the paragraph as follows:

* "HOMO levels" refers to the energy levels of the highest occupied molecular orbitals (HOMOs) of the two polymers.
* "POBDTPD" and "PEBDTPD" are the names of the two polymers being compared in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure, here are the relevant entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties:

1. HOMO (Hydrogen-Oriented Molecular Orbital) - a property of the molecule that describes the energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbital.
2. POBDTPD (Polymer with Backbone-Directed Triple Bonds) - a property of the polymer that describes the type of bonds present in the backbone of the polymer.
3. PEBDTPD (Polymer with Backbone-Directed Triple Bonds and Double Bonds) - a property of the polymer that describes the type of bonds present in the backbone of the polymer, including both triple and double bonds.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| HOMO (Hydrogen-Oriented Molecular Orbital) |
| POBDTPD (Polymer with Backbone-Directed Triple Bonds) |
| PEBDTPD (Polymer with Backbone-Directed Triple Bonds and Double Bonds) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
